comment: Kathryn is an amazing person who cares for her students and hopes they achieve; however, she does have high expectations. Her class is discussion based with no tests or quizzes but do not miss any assignment or your grade will tank. She believes in school being your first priority and doesn't stray far from the rubrics the Honor's College gives her
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Kathryn is absolutely one of the most amazing people that I have ever met. She genuinely loves what she does and wants to help you more than anything. There are no quizzes or tests, and the homework is between 4 to 10 subjective questions. As long as you participate in discussion you'll be one of her favorites. I could not recommend her more.
Super easy and chill teacher. As long as you do the reading prompts you'll pass the class. You don't need to buy the online textbook it's barely used.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is my favorite this semester. She actually cares about her students, and she cares about how everything we learn in class will fit into our lives. She will work with you on anything if you are having trouble and make sure you understand the content. There are no tests. Just a paper, an infographic, a vision plan, and weekly readings.
The greatest teacher you can have first semester of college. She cares about each student and almost feels like a mom. I love her so much and will be keeping in touch. 10/10 recommend.

Professor Wilhite is amazing. We had homework assignments fairly regularly, but I learned something from each and every one of them. She really cares about her students and formed a personal relationship with every one of us. If you can take her, do it! I actually learned stuff in this class that will stick with me for the rest of my life.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
